sentences.english: Week -long national day is coming. I'm looking forword to seeing Yun who was my good classmate at college.
sentences.chinese: 十一長假即將來臨，萬分期待着大學同學贇的到來。

sentences.english: During the New Year's holiday, Hunan Province's tourism market welcomed a heat.
sentences.chinese: 元旦小長假，我省旅遊市場在陽光的催動下開始發熱。

sentences.english: What will you do on Spring Holidays break this year?
sentences.chinese: 今年春節長假你要做什麼？

sentences.english: We have four minor vacations every year.
sentences.chinese: 例句我們每年有四個小長假。

sentences.english: The 15th day of the Lunar New Year marks the end of the weeks-long Chinese New Year festival.
sentences.chinese: 農曆新年的第15天標誌着中國新年數週的長假結束。

sentences.english: Brant , a famous French singer, will have a long holiday.
sentences.chinese: 法國著名歌手本蘭布特今年夏天要休長假。

sentences.english: We can't come back until school breaks up.
We agreed, five one long way to Xuzhou to see me.
sentences.chinese: 我們約定，五一長假丹丹到徐州來看我。

sentences.english: Qingming Festival is the best time to admire the beauty.
sentences.chinese: 清明小長假正是最好的觀賞時節。

sentences.english: We've been working on the report days and nights, we deserve a long vacation.
sentences.chinese: 我們整日整夜地趕這份報告，我們該放個長假了。

sentences.english: I’m still cleaning my post-vacation backlog of feeds and messages.
sentences.chinese: 長假後攢了一堆待閱內容和信息，掃尾工作還在繼續。

sentences.english: Jun years into love China office, accused love China more to the company please long holiday.
sentences.chinese: 君年走入愛華辦公室，指責愛華更向公司請長假。

sentences.english: Much of Europe takes a month-long holiday.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲大多數人在享受一個月的長假。

sentences.english: As a matter of fact, they're thinking of going on a long vacation.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，他們正打算休個長假呢。

sentences.english: Week-long classes during the National Day holiday will help you to consolidate the key knowledge points.
sentences.chinese: 國慶長假七天的考研班也可以幫助鞏固知識要點。

sentences.english: This facilitates the babus taking long holidays in America.
sentences.chinese: 那麼一來，政客們去美國度長假就方便了。

definition: to go on a tour/to have an outing
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
to amuse oneself/to have fun/to go sightseeing/to take a stroll
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
